How can I get a block template using JSON-RPC?

To get a block template using JSON-RPC, you can use the `curl` command to send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus daemon. Here's an example of how to do this:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
This will send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus daemon at `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the `getblocktemplate` method and no parameters. The response will be a block template in JSON format.

Examples: > verus getblocktemplate > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
